title: Professional Portfolio Website
descriptionShort: A showcase of work experience and education history.
descriptionFull: This personal website is a single-page application, implemented with the recently released state hooks in ReactJS.

Notable features include a mobile-friendly design, routing with React Router, email messaging with Formspree microservice, Axios JSON file import with the passing of data via 'props', and a script to procedurally populate the projects' descriptions' Technology Stack with external links.

tech.Libraries and modules: React v16.9 with ES8, Axios, Formspree

title: BMI Calculator ReactJS
descriptionFull: The Body Mass Index (BMI) is defined as the ratio of height to weight.  It is an outdated way to evaulate personal fitness, but can be interesting for a programming exercise.
This single-page, ReactJS application organizes scripts into Components, which are involved in view rendering, and Modules that offload simple calculations on the front end.

title: Rock Paper Scissors
descriptionShort: A digital rendition of the classic childhood game.
descriptionFull: This application uses JS and jQuery to implement an interactive game of Rock, Paper, Scissors.
While optimization was beyond the scope of this project, it is clear that the sluggish rendering of high resolution images can be improved.

title: Address Book
descriptionShort: A sleek UI for digitally storing contacts.
descriptionFull: The Address Book application implements styles from a content delivery network (CDN) and using session storage in the browser to mimic CRUD functionality usually implemented with an api, but with a front-end-only solution.
A demonstration flow for the live site, and a process to generate a local build and run feature tests, is provided in the github documentation.
